dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So Kazakhstan is completely overhauling how it certifies where its products come from, right? President Tokayev just signed this new law.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So Kazakhstan is completely overhauling how it certifies where its products come from, right? President Tokayev just signed this new law.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kassym-Jomart Tokayev has signed a law on determining the country of origin of goods, according to a statement from Akorda.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and the biggest change is that they're creating a digital Register of Kazakhstani Manufacturers. It's part of their e-government system.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and the biggest change is that they're creating a digital Register of Kazakhstani Manufacturers. It's part of their e-government system.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The first block of amendments introduces a Register of Kazakhstani Manufacturers as part of the e-government information and communication infrastructure.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, so it's like a central database for all domestic producers and what they make. And if you're not in that register, you're basically out of luck for state support.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, so it's like a central database for all domestic producers and what they make. And if you're not in that register, you're basically out of luck for state support.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This register will contain data on domestic producers and the goods they manufacture. Manufacturers included in the register will have access to state support measures and participation in public procurement and purchases by quasi-governmental entities.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. No more access to public procurement or those purchases from quasi-governmental entities. It's a huge incentive to get listed.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. No more access to public procurement or those purchases from quasi-governmental entities. It's a huge incentive to get listed.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Only companies listed in this register will be eligible for state support and will be allowed to participate in government and quasi-governmental procurement.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And they're getting rid of those old CT-KZ certificates, which were used to confirm origin. That whole system is just gone now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they're getting rid of those old C T-K Z certificates, which were used to confirm origin. That whole system is just gone now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: With the introduction of the register, CT-KZ certificates and industrial certificates, previously used to confirm the origin of goods, will be abolished, along with the administrative liability for violations during the issuance of expert opinions.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Along with the administrative penalties for messing up expert opinions. So it's streamlining things, but also raising the stakes for manufacturers to be in that official register.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Along with the administrative penalties for messing up expert opinions. So it's streamlining things, but also raising the stakes for manufacturers to be in that official register.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Administrative penalties related to expert opinion violations will also be abolished.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: The second part is interesting too—they're making major buyers implement domestic value development programs. Basically forcing them to boost local production.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The second part is interesting too-they're making major buyers implement domestic value development programs. Basically forcing them to boost local production.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Major buyers will now be required to approve and implement domestic value development programs in accordance with government-established regulations.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and they introduced this new "guaranteed procurement agreement." So the government commits to buying a certain volume long-term from a manufacturer.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and they introduced this new guaranteed procurement agreement. So the government commits to buying a certain volume long-term from a manufacturer.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A new type of contract has been introduced: the guaranteed procurement agreement. Under this contract, a manufacturing enterprise commits to supplying a guaranteed volume of goods produced using its existing capacities on a long-term basis.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: That's a big deal for stability, right? Like, if you're a local factory, you can plan ahead knowing you have guaranteed orders.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's a big deal for stability, right? Like, if you're a local factory, you can plan ahead knowing you have guaranteed orders.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. And then there's the third block—creating a Unified Classifier of Goods, Works, and Services with standardized codes.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. And then there's the third block-creating a Unified Classifier of Goods, Works, and Services with standardized codes.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The third block of amendments provides for the introduction and maintenance of a Unified Classifier of Goods, Works, and Services to standardize classification through a system of codes and names.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, that sounds like it's meant to reduce confusion and maybe even cut down on corruption or the shadow economy by making everything more transparent.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, that sounds like it's meant to reduce confusion and maybe even cut down on corruption or the shadow economy by making everything more transparent.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It will improve transparency in procurement, help trace goods, and reduce the shadow economy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. It should make it easier to track goods and ensure everything is above board. Overall, it seems like a push for more self-reliance and better oversight.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. It should make it easier to track goods and ensure everything is above board. Overall, it seems like a push for more self-reliance and better oversight.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It will improve transparency in procurement, help trace goods, and reduce the shadow economy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely a significant shift in how business and government procurement will operate there moving forward.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely a significant shift in how business and government procurement will operate there moving forward.
